You asked two things about resizing:

Resizing the Container: In the code above, the column holding the image is set to width="30%". This means the container is \(30\%\) of the page width.
Resizing the Image: Inside the column, I added the image attribute {width="100%"}. This tells the image to fill \(100\%\) of its \(30\%\) container. If you want the image to be smaller, you can change this to, for example, {width="75%"}.




By default, the text content might start at the top of its column, while the image naturally sits higher. To make the text content line up more nicely (vertically centered) with the image’s container, you can add a small custom CSS class.
1. Update index.qmd:
Add the class v-center to the right column:
